entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 11:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Stormy Weather For Western Alaska This Weekend... A strong storm will move northeast through the Bering and Chukchi Seas Friday night and into this weekend. This system will bring heavy snow, strong winds, blizzard conditions, and the possibility of freezing rain to areas south of the Seward Peninsula and in the lower Yukon River Valley. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 23 at 9:59AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ice Jam flooding on rivers and streams possible... Ice is beginning to break up on area waterways, with ice jams reported on portions of the Yellowstone River, Tongue River, and Powder River. With warm temperatures in the forecast, ice will begin to break up in more area waterways. As the ice breaks up it may become piled up resulting in an ice jam and localized flooding.
